Package model

Class AdjacentStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.AbstractTargetStrategy
      • model.AdjacentStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TargetStrategy
    public class AdjacentStrategy
extends AbstractTargetStrategy
    Class used to determine the Adjacent Strategy which is used in case of targets around visible tiles that have a distance of 1 from the shooter.It handles requests made by the player to checker whether or not that are players in East,North,West,South and also shoots them IF possible and chosen by player

      • areTargetValid

        public boolean areTargetValid​(Player shooter,
                              java.util.List<Player> targets)
        areTarget valid is a method used to check whether or not the chosen targets by the shooter( the player whose turn it is) or valid or not.
        Specified by:
        areTargetValid in interface TargetStrategy
        Overrides:
        areTargetValid in class AbstractTargetStrategy
        Parameters:
        shooter - is used to identify the player who chooses the targets to shoot at
        targets - is the list of targets chosen by the player whose turn is
        Returns:
        true if all the chosen targets can be shot at,else false

      • canHitSomeone

        public boolean canHitSomeone​(Player shooter)
        Method used to check whether or not you can hit at least one player (let it be a target the player has chosen or not) . In case the player can't hit any other player it returns false so the player can't make use of that effect of the card.
        Specified by:
        canHitSomeone in interface TargetStrategy
        Overrides:
        canHitSomeone in class AbstractTargetStrategy
        Parameters:
        shooter - is used to identify the player who chooses the targets to shoot at
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one player the shooter can shoot at

      • getHittableTargets

        Returns:
